csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: Geographic Feature Code Catalogue
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: fcode
feature catalogue
feature code
BC Data
Open Source
Public Data
Government Data
British Columbia Data
Government of British Columbia
Government information
geoscientificInformation
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: The Geographic Feature Code Catalogue contains codes and definitions for geographic features captured and mapped by various BC Government Ministries, which are responsible for their definitions. These codes (fcodes) are embedded into geographic data to mark them, as an aid to integrating data from many sources. (WHSE_CORP.CORP_FEATURES)

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: Heritage Conservation Areas of BC
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: BC
BC Register of Historic Places
British Columbia
Cultural Heritage
Heritage Conservation Area
environment
heritage
historic
historic place
Government information
environment
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: This dataset contains spatial and attribute data for local government Heritage Conservation Areas (HCAs) established for heritage conservation purposes in British Columbia, as tracked by BC Heritage Branch. Under the Local Government Act, a local government may designate a HCA within its Official Community Plan (OCP). An OCP may include a schedule of properties located within a Heritage Conservation Area that are considered to be protected heritage property. This is a multi-part polygon layer.

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: Salmon Suitability Rating
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: finfish
salmon
salmon suitability
BC Data
Open Source
Public Data
Government Data
British Columbia Data
Government of British Columbia
Government information
geoscientificInformation
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: Salmon Suitability Rating polygons are areas in the British Columbia coastal waters where a "rating" has been assigned for how suitable or appropriate the area is for salmon aquaculture. In addition to ratings for 'Good', 'Medium', 'Poor' and 'Not Advisable', some areas are also flagged as being suitable for Deep Sea Cages.

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: Fibre Recovery Zones
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: Fibre Recovery
Providers
Open Government
BC Data
Open Source
Public Data
Government Data
British Columbia Data
Government of British Columbia
Government information
boundaries
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: The Fibre Recovery Zones (FRZ) define areas where increased waste rates may apply to avoidable waste left on a cutting authority as detailed in the Provincial Logging Residue and Waste Measurement Procedure Manual. The boundaries have been approved by the Director of the Forest Tenures Branch, Ministry of Forests, Lands, Natural Resource Operations and Rural Development. Current extent of the data is for the Coast Fibre Recovery Zones only.

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: Community Health Service Areas - CHSA
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: CHSA
Community Health Service Area
Geography
Health
Health Boundary
LHA
Government Data
British Columbia Data
Government of British Columbia
Government information
boundaries
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: Community Health Service Area (CHSA) boundaries; 2018 boundary configuration. On April 1, 2019, the Ministry of Health released a new geography classification that introduces community-level geographies nested within the Local Health Areas. The CHSAs are a mutually exclusive and exhaustive classification of the land area in BC. CHSAs are contiguous (land area is geographically adjacent) and fit within the existing geographical hierarchy (cannot violate higher-level geography boundaries such as the Local Health Area).

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: Historic Trail Features of British Columbia
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: BC
British Columbia
Environment
Heritage
Recreation
heritage
heritage trail
historic
trail
Government information
environment
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: This dataset contains spatial and tabular data on non-archaeological historic trails in B.C. Some of these trails, or sections of trail, are defined or protected under provincial legislation such as the Heritage Conservation Act. Other trails or trail segments are recorded but not legally protected. This dataset represents point feature data (e.g. cabins, landmarks).

Other trails or trail segments are recorded but not legally protected. This dataset represents line feature data (e.g. trail routes).

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: BC Wild Mountain Sheep Registry - Distribution
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: bighorn sheep
mountain sheep
sheep distribution
sheep herd registry
thinhorn sheep
wild sheep
Government Data
British Columbia Data
Government of British Columbia
Government information
biota
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: A spatial representation of the general distribution of wild mountain sheep (bighorn and thinhorn sheep) in British Columbia. Populations that extend into neighbouring provinces and states are also included. The distribution polygons are divided by species into bighorn and thinhorn sheep.

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: CLP
Crown Land

communication sites pricing
communication sites zones
crown land pricing
pricing
British Columbia Data

boundaries
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: Rent calculation for the use of Crown land for communication sites purposes is based on zonal rates per site per user category. There are currently 3 zones covering the province. The dataset outlines the boundaries for these zones.

csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: Rent calculation for the use of Crown land for log handling purposes is based on zonal land values. There are currently 11 zones covering the province. The dataset outlines the boundaries for these zones.

csw:SummaryRecord.dc:title: BC Hexagonal Grid
csw:SummaryRecord.dc:subject: Canada
grid
hexagon
network connectivity
Open Source
Public Data
Government Data
British Columbia Data
Government of British Columbia
Government information
boundaries,utilitiesCommuncation
csw:SummaryRecord.dct:abstract: The BC Hexagonal Grid is a geospatial grid of individual hexagons covering the Province of BC. Each Hexagon is approximately 25 square kilometres in size, except at the provincial border where the hexagons have been split on the boundary.
